result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron E Mixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron E Mixon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron E Mixon was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DK unless approved by agent.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
